Which way will he go? What is the alternate route?

He will concentrate only on Tetsu---this is forshadowed in the first
episode when Tetsu runs into him on the bridge and Tetsu says "why are
you walking in the middle of the bridge" (Tetsu was running to sign up
to get in the Shinsengumi) and Suzu says "we else will I walk"...the
characters are from the same mold but coming from different
directions...as long as their last show down doesn't end with one them
self combusting then I'll be happy

*I thought it was interesting how Enishi's grief in RK is expressed
physically through his white hair...and it is probably the same
symbolism with Suzu seeing how in 19th century Japan the platinum hair
color wasn't really the "in" thing yet

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Grace Battista" <mg_batt@y...> wrote:
> Oh! But that is why I love him... I used to think of him as 
> a "filler", a cameo... Actually I thought the same about Tetsu, 
> probably because I started watching only to see the Shinsengumi 
> bishies ^_^ Back to Suzu, it's so obvious that there's promise in 
> his character. I just hope like you, that the writers handle the 
> whole thing correctly. Right now if the anime continued, he'd be the 
> guy hating both the Ishin-shishis and the Miburos, which is why he's 
> so interesting. Which way will he go? What is the alternate route?
